column4: Why does firefox run when I type 'sudo firefox' but not only 'firefox' and it works when I do 'firefox -ProfileManager'
but not when I type 'firefox' rather
perhaps your firefox user data is screwed
does moving ~/firefox out of the way fix it?
It says no such directory
~/.mozilla/firefox, then
No such directory again
how odd
I can create a new profile and it loads up just fine.. I just had a lot of trouble with firefox earlier and I did an apt-get remove of it and it's been doing this ever since I tried to reinstall it
removing it won't have affected this
This all started because I was trying to upgrade firefox *sigh*
It would probably be easier to just reinstall ubuntu, lol
I was trying to update firefox because of the security patches..
I really doubt reinstalling is a useful course of action
er, that was silly, the version in ubuntu has all those security patches
I had 1.0.2 installed and apt-get told me that there were updates avaiable.
yes, which have the patches applied to 1.0.2
So.. Am I just screwed over and no way to fix my problem?
of course not
presumably, getting rid of your local firefox data would fix it;you never explained how you broke it to begin with, though
if it involved "backports", then you have to talk to them
